Function to plot data. (For now can replace splnr_plot_cost(), splnr_plot_binFeature(), splnr_plot_MPAs(),splnr_plot_featureNo())

Source: R/splnr_plot.R
splnr_plot.Rd

Written by Kilian Barreiro Written: February 2024

Usage

splnr_plot(
  df,
  col_names = NULL,
  paletteName = "YlGnBu",
  colorVals = NULL,
  plot_title = "",
  showFeatureSum = FALSE
)

Arguments

df

The dataframe containing the data to be plotted. It must include a geometry column to be used with geom_sf.

col_names

A list of column names to include in the plot. If specified, only these columns will be used to color the plot.

paletteName

The name of the color palette to use for filling. Default is "YlGnBu".

colorVals

The color values to use if col_names is specified and the data is binary.

plot_title

The title of the plot.

showFeatureSum

A boolean indicator to specify if the feature sum should be displayed.

Value

A ggplot object.

Details

Plot Spatial Data, returns a gg object

Examples

# Binary
splnr_plot(dat_species_bin, col_names = "Spp1")
#> Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will
#> replace the existing one.


# Continuous
bathymetry <- oceandatr::get_bathymetry(spatial_grid = dat_PUs, keep = FALSE,
classify_bathymetry = FALSE)
#> This may take seconds to minutes, depending on grid size
#>

splnr_plot(df = bathymetry, col_names = "bathymetry", plot_title = "bathymetry")
#> Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will
#> replace the existing one.


# Multi binary features
splnr_plot(dat_species_bin, showFeatureSum = TRUE)
#> Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will
#> replace the existing one.
